description:
Your driving record
How much you drive
Your credit history
The state you live in
The value of your car

If you've never been in an accident and you're only driving your car a few miles a week, you'll have cheaper insurance than somebody who wrecked their car last year and racks up serious miles on a long commute. It's just more of a risk for the insurer.
title: What else affects the cost of insurance?
